entry.tran: 好管闲事的；爱指手画脚的
entry.def: If you describe someone as officious, you are critical of them because they are eager to tell people what to do when you think they should not.

example.ex: They wouldn't welcome any officious interference from the police...
example.tran: 他们不会欢迎任何来自警方的横加干涉。

example.ex: When people put on uniforms, their attitude becomes more confident and their manner more officious.
example.tran: 人们穿上制服后会信心倍增，也更爱管闲事了。

sentences.sentence: "nothing so fatal as to strive too officiously for an abstract quality like beauty"

auth_sentence.content: It just did not strive officiously to keep it alive.

auth_sentence.content: When all the meatball ingredients are not too officiously amalgamated, start rolling them into balls.
